post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

body: Why do I hate grow adults that dress up in animal costumes to fuck each other? Hell if thats all it was I wouldn't. post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

author.bio: Nemu has the best pfp. i have the second best pfp.
author.bio_html: Nemu has the best pfp. i have the second best pfp.

body:
i don't "hate" furries but i don't like them either, im more neutral towards them, but there's tewo things that really piss me of, is it the bizzare fetishes? aslong as it doesn't hurt anyone or anything, honestly finding any fetish thing is hard unless you look for it, even in a fanbase that pushes it onto your face (ill get to that later) is it the cringe cringe? no problem i can just ignore it so what's the problem?

Calling them out on anything makes them extremly triggered, sometimes it's not even any criticism just making a joke against them triggers them so hard, hence their so easy to troll, hence there's a ton of nazi larping edgelords trolling them, it's just so easy it isn't even fun anymore, let alone when they give actual criticism, like the fact i see more cringy furries than normal furries, like in any other fanbase it would be a loud minority but with furries i swear it's a good chunk of the fanbase, yet they get incredibly triggered and act like their being super opressed and pretending there isn't a huge weird side for the fanbase.

another reason is that now you can't even like anthropomorfic animals or media related to them without being associated with furries, like just because i like Sonic it doesn't make me a furry, i just think the characters are appealing and well designed ok? if anything there's more weeaboos than furries in the Sonic fandom based off my own experience.

**TLDR: Furries get triggered too easily, and you can't even like anthros without being associated with them**
body_html:
i don't "hate" furries but i don't like them either, im more neutral towards them, but there's tewo things that really piss me of, is it the bizzare fetishes? aslong as it doesn't hurt anyone or anything, honestly finding any fetish thing is hard unless you look for it, even in a fanbase that pushes it onto your face (ill get to that later) is it the cringe cringe? no problem i can just ignore it so what's the problem?

Calling them out on anything makes them extremly triggered, sometimes it's not even any criticism just making a joke against them triggers them so hard, hence their so easy to troll, hence there's a ton of nazi larping edgelords trolling them, it's just so easy it isn't even fun anymore, let alone when they give actual criticism, like the fact i see more cringy furries than normal furries, like in any other fanbase it would be a loud minority but with furries i swear it's a good chunk of the fanbase, yet they get incredibly triggered and act like their being super opressed and pretending there isn't a huge weird side for the fanbase.

another reason is that now you can't even like anthropomorfic animals or media related to them without being associated with furries, like just because i like Sonic it doesn't make me a furry, i just think the characters are appealing and well designed ok? if anything there's more weeaboos than furries in the Sonic fandom based off my own experience.

TLDR: Furries get triggered too easily, and you can't even like anthros without being associated with them

post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

body:
I know a furry personally. Well, actually two of them. One is a woman who wears ears and a tail.... a lot of the time in public and self-identifies as a wolf. The other is a gay guy who also enjoys Larping and conventions in costume, mostly SteamPunk, makes his own costumes, as well, plays D&D religiously, that sort of thing. 

Neither are deviants. The gay guy just likes to socialize a lot, meets a lot of different people in the course of partying, and likes to hang out and see what things are about. He's very open minded and will pretty much try anything once. The girl...... comes from a very abusive home with a lot of religious undertones and has extreme self-esteem issues. Right now, in her early twenties, she's looking for validation and an identity outside of the abuse she's suffered, and she's struggling pretty hard. I invited her over to a family get together last weekend--BBQ, firepit, some family games and what not. I made some snarky remark to my nephew (who I love to pick on, the little jerk--lol). He knew it was just Auntie Quantum, and he shot back at me (burned me good, too, the little shit--lol). But she got momentarily upset about my remark to him and begged me not to "pick on him". Dead serious. She had never had anyone tease her before without it coming from a place of cruelty. She actually said to me before she left, she had never seen a family like mine that played together and laughed and teased one another. That hit me right in the Feels. I mean, what sort of family doesn't like, pick on and tease each other and make snarky jokes? 

The point being, some furries are okay, just struggling with this thing called Life. The only experience most on here have of them are the memes, and the Reddit crazies. They're like vegans. They're into a "lifestyle" and they're determined to shove it down everyone else's throat no matter what, or else--or they really are weirdo pedo deviants out to groom kids by taking advantage of people like the girl I'm talking about. The girl I know is none of those things. She's extremely polite---the first time I met her she asked first if it was okay if she wore her ears/tail, or if it would make me uncomfortable to be with her in public. She asked me again before coming over if my family would have an issue with it, and said she wouldn't wear it if it would make anyone feel awkward. No one had an issue with it, or even batted a lash (my family is pretty awesome). She was extremely kind and polite the entire time she was over, helped clean up before she left. She doesn't harp on and on about her "furry" persona...... She informed me of it, I said, Okay, whatever, and once in a blue moon she'll make a joking comment out her inner "wolf" and that's it. She doesn't wallow or rub your face in it. It's a part of her like having blue hair or wearing Goth clothes, but it's not a constant, unrelenting topic, if you know what I mean. Hell, she hasn't even admitted her parents abused her, I just picked up on it from observation and little things she's said in passing. 

Someday, she's either going to commit suicide, or turn into a normal person. I hope it's the latter. I hope that by being kind to her, she sees that not everyone has to live the way she was brought up, and she can find, I don't know, something in herself worth saving and look forward to that's different than what she knows. And then she can put the ears and tail in the closet and not have to fall back on an inner "wolf" persona to make herself feel stronger and more in control to survive the abuse she's obviously suffered that made her want to have some weird fantasy about a being a wolf in the first place.
body_html:
I know a furry personally. Well, actually two of them. One is a woman who wears ears and a tail.... a lot of the time in public and self-identifies as a wolf. The other is a gay guy who also enjoys Larping and conventions in costume, mostly SteamPunk, makes his own costumes, as well, plays D&D religiously, that sort of thing.

Neither are deviants. The gay guy just likes to socialize a lot, meets a lot of different people in the course of partying, and likes to hang out and see what things are about. He's very open minded and will pretty much try anything once. The girl...... comes from a very abusive home with a lot of religious undertones and has extreme self-esteem issues. Right now, in her early twenties, she's looking for validation and an identity outside of the abuse she's suffered, and she's struggling pretty hard. I invited her over to a family get together last weekend--BBQ, firepit, some family games and what not. I made some snarky remark to my nephew (who I love to pick on, the little jerk--lol). He knew it was just Auntie Quantum, and he shot back at me (burned me good, too, the little shit--lol). But she got momentarily upset about my remark to him and begged me not to "pick on him". Dead serious. She had never had anyone tease her before without it coming from a place of cruelty. She actually said to me before she left, she had never seen a family like mine that played together and laughed and teased one another. That hit me right in the Feels. I mean, what sort of family doesn't like, pick on and tease each other and make snarky jokes?

The point being, some furries are okay, just struggling with this thing called Life. The only experience most on here have of them are the memes, and the Reddit crazies. They're like vegans. They're into a "lifestyle" and they're determined to shove it down everyone else's throat no matter what, or else--or they really are weirdo pedo deviants out to groom kids by taking advantage of people like the girl I'm talking about. The girl I know is none of those things. She's extremely polite---the first time I met her she asked first if it was okay if she wore her ears/tail, or if it would make me uncomfortable to be with her in public. She asked me again before coming over if my family would have an issue with it, and said she wouldn't wear it if it would make anyone feel awkward. No one had an issue with it, or even batted a lash (my family is pretty awesome). She was extremely kind and polite the entire time she was over, helped clean up before she left. She doesn't harp on and on about her "furry" persona...... She informed me of it, I said, Okay, whatever, and once in a blue moon she'll make a joking comment out her inner "wolf" and that's it. She doesn't wallow or rub your face in it. It's a part of her like having blue hair or wearing Goth clothes, but it's not a constant, unrelenting topic, if you know what I mean. Hell, she hasn't even admitted her parents abused her, I just picked up on it from observation and little things she's said in passing.

Someday, she's either going to commit suicide, or turn into a normal person. I hope it's the latter. I hope that by being kind to her, she sees that not everyone has to live the way she was brought up, and she can find, I don't know, something in herself worth saving and look forward to that's different than what she knows. And then she can put the ears and tail in the closet and not have to fall back on an inner "wolf" persona to make herself feel stronger and more in control to survive the abuse she's obviously suffered that made her want to have some weird fantasy about a being a wolf in the first place.

I hope that by being kind to her, she sees that not everyone has to live the way she was brought up, and she can find, I don't know, something in herself worth saving and look forward to that's different than what she knows. And then she can put the ears and tail in the closet and not have to fall back on an inner "wolf" persona to make herself feel stronger and more in control to survive the abuse she's obviously suffered that made her want to have some weird fantasy about a being a wolf in the first place.

post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

body:
Monster girl - there's some overlap with furries, and that's where the problems occur. Most of us don't like shit made for furries, and most of them don't like shit made for us. People go out looking for shit they want, find shit they weren't looking for, then try to justify why they don't like it and pull shit out of their ass.

Honestly though, as they've continued to isolate themselves more into their own corners of the internet, they've done a better job of leaving other communities alone. Its a lot harder for them to find shit they don't want when they stick to sites dedicated to what they want. The only problem now is when you get the *very* rare content creator that does content for both communities.
body_html:
Monster girl - there's some overlap with furries, and that's where the problems occur. Most of us don't like shit made for furries, and most of them don't like shit made for us. People go out looking for shit they want, find shit they weren't looking for, then try to justify why they don't like it and pull shit out of their ass.

Honestly though, as they've continued to isolate themselves more into their own corners of the internet, they've done a better job of leaving other communities alone. Its a lot harder for them to find shit they don't want when they stick to sites dedicated to what they want. The only problem now is when you get the very rare content creator that does content for both communities.

post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

body:
A lot of the furry fandom isn't in it for sexual reasons. A classmate of mine became a furry shortly after he graduated from school, and helped head what was once the largest furry convention in Europe. He's actually rather known in the UK's furry community.

Those who are into it to draw lewd art of anthropomorphic animals or jerk off to said lewd art I feel uncomfortable around.

The ones that take their fetish way too far and think it's fine to fuck animals (think Kero the Wolf) I hate.
body_html:
A lot of the furry fandom isn't in it for sexual reasons. A classmate of mine became a furry shortly after he graduated from school, and helped head what was once the largest furry convention in Europe. He's actually rather known in the UK's furry community.

Those who are into it to draw lewd art of anthropomorphic animals or jerk off to said lewd art I feel uncomfortable around.

The ones that take their fetish way too far and think it's fine to fuck animals (think Kero the Wolf) I hate.

post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

body:
For what its worth, I don't expect rando's in generic guilds like +AskRuqqus to be into this shit, if anything I'd expect to get dunked on for it.

Worth noting: Its more of a genre than any one thing, though. Some pretty common shit falls under it; succubi, vampires, elves, nymphs, angels, demons. I swear people have been into this shit for thousands of years, they just didn't have a convenient (and inaccurately named) tag to refer to it as.
body_html:
For what its worth, I don't expect rando's in generic guilds like +AskRuqqus to be into this shit, if anything I'd expect to get dunked on for it.

Worth noting: Its more of a genre than any one thing, though. Some pretty common shit falls under it; succubi, vampires, elves, nymphs, angels, demons. I swear people have been into this shit for thousands of years, they just didn't have a convenient (and inaccurately named) tag to refer to it as.

parent.body:
For what its worth, I don't expect rando's in generic guilds like +AskRuqqus to be into this shit, if anything I'd expect to get dunked on for it.

Worth noting: Its more of a genre than any one thing, though. Some pretty common shit falls under it; succubi, vampires, elves, nymphs, angels, demons. I swear people have been into this shit for thousands of years, they just didn't have a convenient (and inaccurately named) tag to refer to it as.
parent.body_html:
For what its worth, I don't expect rando's in generic guilds like +AskRuqqus to be into this shit, if anything I'd expect to get dunked on for it.

post.title: People who hate Furries, What are your reasons to hate them?

body:
Internet Historian summarized this sub-culture of rampant degeneracy years ago.  They compete to outdo one another.  Moreover, there are tons of red flags and warning signs when it comes to combining sexual confusion and fetishes with facsimiles of animals.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmULc5VANsw

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rddog2Y70hU
